intro: Dendropanax pallidus, commonly known as the slender tree-panax, is a flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves with alternating leaflets. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. Dendropanax pallidus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
